column4: i got a desktop im triyng to install unbuntu onto.first attempt the CD corrupted or something and an incomplete ubuntu is still there.reburned a new install cd.im trying to remove the old ubuntu but the install cd wont install over it and xp is on the other partition
Boot the disk and use the verify feature to test the disk for errors.
What version?
Does a live session boot up?
So how far does the install get before failing?
- any suggestins for my problem or are you still tracking?
Test your memory with memtest86 maybe?
- huh?im trying remove failed ubuntu install
What exactly are you trying to do? Reinstall? Format the drive?
- first cd corrupted and half installed ubuntu.its still there but pc doesnt reconise it but new ubuntu instal does but wont install over it and cant figure out how to remove
Then your is FUBAR. No reason ubuntu cant overwrite a drive.
Less you have failing hardware or some such.
-new HDD.
live session. gparted erase the drive and then reinstall.
Are you trying to mix Windows and Ubuntu on the same machine?
- gparted erase? yes trying to dual os
I figured. Forgive my tone, but I dont know why newbs try and run before they walk.No better way to say it.
- i already did dual install with vista and ubuntu on laptop
IMO mixing is more trouble than its worth,
Sorry I said excuse the tone. hehe
Im actually very helpfull.
- if i can remove the old ubuntu i can get ubuntu installed side by side but the problem is i cant erase it
Sorry i cant help you.
